title: Ch. 3 of Speaker's Meaning by Owen Barfield: Language - Achievement or Gift? Yes? No? Complicated.
description:
Links discussed during the video are following the notes.

Karen and Michael tackle Chapter 3 of Speaker's Meaning by Owen Barfield, looking at the changes in individual consciousness over the millennia from inspiration to imagination. We also explore the meaning of courage, commitment and sacrifice and consider the differences between seeing something as a gift versus seeing it as an achievement.

Previous episodes in which we discuss Speaker's Meaning:
Chapter 1: Accuracy and Expression as Opponent Processing:  https://youtu.be/bb5IPyoePjM
Chapter 2: Snowflakes and Fairytales: Proportion, Imperfections and Symmetry: https://youtu.be/xyU5VqJwsVI
Radical Orthodoxy and its Intersection with Owen Barfield:  https://youtu.be/YHXVeCO8CY0

The movie Karen talked about that is a brilliant exploration of the meaning of events:  
Life Itself   
Bishop Barron discussiing St. Irenaeus and Gnosticism
    https://youtu.be/db_30gftdOo
The 3Blue1Brown video about fractals, 2's and 3's:  
https://youtu.be/-RdOwhmqP5sk (especially the intro, and then 12 to 21)
